info-registry-entry.namespace-title: Namespace of identifiers used by the European Repository Systems for describing semantic relationships in Compound and Complex documents.

namespace-authority.organisation-address: Gottingen State and University Library, Platz der Gottinger Sieben 1, 37073 Gottingen, Germany

identifier-syntax.description:
Identifiers in the eu-repo namespace are used to identify information assets used in the European Research Libraries. The syntax is of the form: info:eu-repo/_type_/_identifier_
whereby: * _type_ gives an indication of the nature and purpose of the identifier. Current values for _type_ include: 'semantics' and 'dai'. The meaning is explained in the Namespace Information section. * _identifier_ is a unique string assigned to the information asset. * _identifier_ can be replaced by _subType_/_identifier_
Examples: * info:eu-repo/semantics/descriptiveMetadata * info:eu-repo/semantics/objectFile * info:eu-repo/semantics/humanStartPage * info:eu-repo/dai/nl/12345 * info:eu-repo/semantics/researchProposal

identifier-normalization.description: All identifiers in the eu-repo namespace are case-sensitive.

namespace-information.description:
Identifiers in the eu-repo namespace are used to identify information assets used in the European Research Libraries. Different types of identifiers are used in the repository, including: Semantic Identifiers, Publication Types and Digital Author Identifiers.
# Identifiers for Semantic terms: Identifiers used to represent properties of assets stored in the repository, or relationships between such assets. These identifiers are used in RDF or DIDL statements. These identifiers are of the form info:eu-repo/semantics/_identifier_ whereby _identifier_ is a unique string acorded to a property or type of relationship. Official Enumerations: * info:eu-repo/semantics/descriptiveMetadata --> Defines the information about the item * info:eu-repo/semantics/objectFile --> Defines the object item * info:eu-repo/semantics/humanStartPage --> defines the location used for human beings to start
# Identifiers for publication types: Identifiers to represent the type of publication. These identifiers are of the form info:eu-repo/semantics/_identifier_ Official Enumerations: * info:eu-repo/semantics/annotation * info:eu-repo/semantics/article * info:eu-repo/semantics/bachelorThesis * info:eu-repo/semantics/book * info:eu-repo/semantics/bookPart * info:eu-repo/semantics/bookReview * info:eu-repo/semantics/contributionToPeriodical * info:eu-repo/semantics/doctoralThesis * info:eu-repo/semantics/researchProposal * info:eu-repo/semantics/lecture * info:eu-repo/semantics/masterThesis * info:eu-repo/semantics/researchPaper * info:eu-repo/semantics/patent * info:eu-repo/semantics/preprint * info:eu-repo/semantics/report * info:eu-repo/semantics/studentThesis * info:eu-repo/semantics/technicalDocumentation
# Identifiers for Authors: Identifiers that are used to represent the author in a unique way. * info:eu-repo/dai/_ISO3166_/_uniqueNationalString_ Where by: _ISO3166_ is the two letter code for countries. http://www.iso.org/iso/country_codes/iso_3166_code_lists/ Example: * info:eu-repo/dai/nl/12345
